text:
48 y/o female admitted from OSH after ingesting ~100 percocets, valium,
   and methadone over 4 days.  Stated that she has lost 32lbs in  past
   week. Denied SI, HI, or AH/VH. Stated feeling depressed (husband died a
   few years ago).  Serum acetaminophen 31.7.  Acetylcysteine gtt started
   at OSH. PIV x2 placed at OSH. 1 PIV placed in ER. In ER, given 2L NS
   and continued on acetylseistine gtt. Upon arrival to MICU, arrousable
   to voice. Follows some commands.  Slow to answer questions. Ox1
   (person). MAE weakly on bed. Turning self in bed. Denied pain.
   Poisoning / Overdose, Acetaminophen (Tylenol, APAP)
   Assessment:
   IN ER AST 1880, ALT [**2194**], INR 2.2, K 5.1, Mg 1.7, phos 1.1 and
   acetaminophen 31.7.  Lethargic and confused.
   Action:
   Acetylcysteine gtt continued (third dose).  NS 500 cc bolus given and
   two of three L given @ 150cc/hr. Given 2gm magnesium IV.  Given 2pkt
   neutra phos. Labs monitored. UOP monitored.
   Response:
   Repeat labs AST 1403, ALT 1728, Tbili 2.9. UOP>80cc/hr.
   Plan:
   Continue acetylcysteine gtt until acetaminophen serum level
   undetectable. Monitor mental status. Monitor labs/lytes. Given 3^rd L
   of NS.
   Hematemesis (upper GI bleed, UGIB)
   Assessment:
   Vomited ~200cc of
coffee ground
 emesis. Denied nausea. HCT 36(38). No
   BM. +BS.
   Action:
   NGtube placed and levagged.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Altered mental status
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
